p.The certificate program in Hospitality I: The certificate program in Hospitality Information Technology focuses on developing students' understanding of hospitality information technology. Students who complete this certificate program will have gained experience in information technology, social media, digital marketing, network security and data management in the hospitality and tourism industry.

courseSection0.text: The certificate program in Hospitality Information Technology focuses on developing students' understanding of hospitality information technology. Students who complete this certificate program will have gained experience in information technology, social media, digital marketing, network security and data management in the hospitality and tourism industry.

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
HFT3444 - Hospitality Information Systems (3)
HFT3505 - Social Media Management in the Hospitality Industry (3)
HFT3447 - Database Management and Internet Security for Hospitality Organizations (3)
courseSection0.text1:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
HFT3443 - Event Technology (3)
HFT3564 - Digital Marketing for Hospitality Organizations (3)

li.No course grade lower than a C will be a: No course grade lower than a C will be accepted for the certificate requirements.
li.The average GPA for the four courses mus: The average GPA for the four courses must be 3.00 and higher.
li.All 12 credit hours used towards the cer: All 12 credit hours used towards the certificate must be earned at UCF.

courseSection0.text:
Certificate Requirements
No course grade lower than a C will be accepted for the certificate requirements.
The average GPA for the four courses must be 3.00 and higher.
All 12 credit hours used towards the certificate must be earned at UCF.

Foreign Language Requirements

None
